config.question: How did Columbus manage to convince the Spanish monarchs to financially back his “Enterprise of the Indies”?

choices.content: by capitalizing on the rivalry between Spain and Portugal
by promising them discovery of the America would further the Reformation
by offering to set up sugar plantations in the Indies

answer_3.response: Spain’s aggressive new monarchs envied the success of their neighbor, Portugal. Columbus played on the rivalry between the countries, talking of wealth and empire. Columbus’s stubborn lobbying wore down the Spanish court, and the Spanish sovereigns provided him with three ships.
